areaDesc.3: Quiet and clean suburban development of good character. Houses are substantially built on good size lots. Good transportation.
areaDesc.4: No shopping center. Distance to schools.
areaDesc.14: This was a promotional development by a local operator who sold the lots to young business men of Altoona. The section has held up rather well and is considered a very desirable neighborhood. Heavy foreclosures in this area.

areaDesc.3: Cheap rents. Near schools and transportation.
areaDesc.4: Heavy vacancy of units. Low class occupants. Vandalized houses in poor conditions. Lack of local demand for row houses.
areaDesc.14: Altoona people are not as receptive to row housing irrespective of cost. These houses are vacant to a large percentage in spite of the housing shortage. The development was an operation of a Philadelphia builder, but the section never receoved any local support.

areaDesc.3: Clean area with good transportation. Desirable residential neighborhood of high class people. Close to school.
areaDesc.4: Nominal
areaDesc.14: Section is attractive to RR executives at shops, particularly those at nearby Juniata.

areaDesc.3: Close to city-good transportation and schools. Recreation field in area.
areaDesc.4: RR smoke from Pa. RR main line. Obsolescence. Small lots.

12.a: Setion has been cleaned up considerably in recent years trough efforts of a Catholic Priest. Hoodlums have been forced to leave the neighborhood, and the general character of the area has improved slightly. at present the housing is a poor third grade with some rather good units scattered throughout.

areaDesc.14: A sparsely settled section of fair houses. Two new factories which have recently located in Altoona are convenient to this section.

areaDesc.3: Quiet and clean neighborhood of good character with desirable housing. Homongenous as to development on fair size lots. Good transportation and schools.
areaDesc.4: None except distance to center of city.

5.a: White collar class, local business men

areaDesc.14: This is a good second grade section which is well protected against undesirable encroachment. Mortage money would certainly be available on favorable terms if the local institutions were in a position to loan. This neighborhood is distinctly suburban in character with houses fairly well spaced.

areaDesc.3: Good schools and transportation. Fairly desirable section of modest homes. Area is clean and quiet.
areaDesc.4: Unpaved streets and no sidewalks. Distance to center of city.
areaDesc.14: A sparsely settled section of fair houses. Two new factories which have recently located in Altoona are convenient to this section.

areaDesc.3: Section enjoys a very good reputation. Desirable and well planned area of good houses on good sized lots. Good transportation & Schools.
areaDesc.4: Nominal
areaDesc.14: In point of desirability this is a first grade section, but in view of age and general appearance of the housing the section rates only good second grade. Area enjoys a good reputation and is similar in general character to section A-1, but ground values are lower and the housing is not kept in as fine condition. A foreign section backs up to Ruskin Ave properties, but is reputed to have little effect on this neighborhood.

areaDesc.3: Quiet and clean neighborhood. Good schools; and transportation fairly desirable section of modest homes on small lots.
areaDesc.4: Distance to center of city. No sidewalks - many unpaved streets
areaDesc.14: An outlying section free from objectionable influences. F.H.A. financing is not available because of small lots. Housing is similar in character to section C-8 although not as old not as completely built up.

areaDesc.3: Near gold course. Good transportation. Restricted as to price and improvements. Good view of mountains.
areaDesc.4: Unpaved streets. No sidewalk, distance to center of city.
areaDesc.14: A small area of modest homes in desirable location well protected from objectionable influences. This is a fair to poor second class section.

areaDesc.3: The most desirable seciton of Altoona in point of location, class of people, homogeneity of development and freedom from objectionable influences.
areaDesc.4: None except heavy traffic on Union Ave.
areaDesc.14: Only 2 sales in past five years have been made in this section. This section is a good first grade neighborhood well protected against undesirable encroachment. Houses are built on large lots and set well back from the street.

15.1: Chas. McVey-Property Management Broker HOLC, Paul H. Faris Local realtor and Correspondent Prudential Ins. Co.

areaDesc.3: Very desirable residential, well located and well planned, character of this area is very good. Good transportation and schools.
areaDesc.4: Heavy traffic on Union Ave. through the section.
areaDesc.14: This section is similar in general character to section A-1, although somewhat older and more extensively developed. Additional building will ensue in this neighborhood as general economic conditions improve.

areaDesc.3: Good transportation and schools. Good reputation of area. Substantial neighborhood.
areaDesc.4: Nominal
areaDesc.14: Few foreclosures with few distress sales which helped hold up prices. Some reconditioning is improving neighborhood. Favorably effected by proximity to section A-2.

areaDesc.3: Two new factories recently moved into section. Good schools. clean and quiet section of fair character.
areaDesc.4: Poor transportation. Unpaved streets, no sidewalks. Distance to high school.
areaDesc.14: City water now throughout the area. A glass manufacturing plant and a textile manufacturer recently moved into Altoona near this section. Employment thus nearby is expected to make this section more desirable. The bulk of employees in the textile mill are women.

areaDesc.3: All streets and alleys paved. Good schools, churches and transportation.
areaDesc.4: Section is becoming spotty with lower class foreign, Smoke and dirt from RR blown into the area. Small lots.
areaDesc.14: About 10 houses fronting on 24th St. between Bell and Fourth Ave. are very high grad costing from $10,000 to $15,000 each which now range in price from $6000-8500. The four corners at second avenue and 18th St are $6500 houses in a $3000 neigborhood. Area is still attractive to RR trainmen and shopmen.

areaDesc.3: Clean, quiet suburban atmosphere
areaDesc.4: No sidewalks, no pavements, no water, no sweres, poor housing.
areaDesc.14: Section was developed after the war. Buildings were built at rear of lots with intention of convertin property to chicken coops or barms, but conversion has not taken place to any extent. Only one or two good houses in the area and these are distinctly out of place.

areaDesc.3: Quiet and clean suburbal section of fairly good homes. Good bus transportation.
areaDesc.4: Surrounded by poor housing. Heavy traffic on Pleasant Valley Pike. Poor school accomodations.
areaDesc.14: Sewer connections have just become available recently and the sewer line now runs along Pleasant Valley Boulevard. It was built with P.W.A funds This is a small section developed by one man. Houses are fairly substantial but the surrounding neighborhood is poor. There was a good number of foreclosures in the area.

areaDesc.3: Large lots. Good schools and transportation. Clean area.
areaDesc.4: Distance to town. No paved streets, no sidewalks.
areaDesc.14: Sewers are now available in the section. A sparsely settled section lying at the bottom of the slope from Grant St. Houses are very modest and most residents have small gardens.

areaDesc.3: Good transportation - Near school, clean and quiet neighborhood
areaDesc.4: Crossing of high spreed throughfare to grade school. Distance from center of city.
areaDesc.14: Entire area was developed by an operation builder. The section is a very desirable residential area for shopmen in R.R. repair plants. This is a modest neighborhood of fair housing.

areaDesc.3: A small section of good grade homes all fronting on Jaggard St. Homogeneous in character and very desirable as residential.
areaDesc.4: No transportation. Poor school facilities. Residents pay tuition for city school privilege.
areaDesc.14: Residents must transport their children to city schools and pay tuition. Area is desirable residential neighborhood of substantial houses on large lots.

areaDesc.3: Quiet and clean suburban section of modest homes. Houses are built on fair sized lots.
areaDesc.4: Distance to center of city. Unpaved Streets, lack of sidewalks.
areaDesc.14: Houses at present have no sewers, but a sewer line has just been completed along the Pleasant Valley Boulevard which will tend to improve the area. Neighborhood now is a poor second grade section.

areaDesc.3: Near employment. Paved streets and alleys. Good transportation Near schools.
areaDesc.4: Dirt and smoke from R. R. Poor class of populace. Housing in bad condition.
areaDesc.14: Area between 7th St. and Kettle St. including 8th and 9th Avenues has been purchased by Pa. R.R. for classification yard. Much of the property has been demolished and the balance will be soon.

areaDesc.3: Good transportation and schools. Near center of city. Desirable section with good reputation.
areaDesc.4: Obsolescence - changing neighborhood. Small lots.
areaDesc.14: An old section of Altoona which continues to enjoy a good reputation. Some converted houses in the area. Cheaper units are distress property. Financing through F. H. A. is not available because of small lots. Many old families still residing in original houses. A fair to poor second grade section which has restrained its residential desirability.

areaDesc.3: Desirable section of modest homes in clean neighborhood. Good transportation & schools, convenient to shopping center.
areaDesc.4: Nominal
areaDesc.14: A desirable section in good demand. Character of neighborhood is good. This is a good third grade section.

areaDesc.3: Paved streets
areaDesc.4: Poor transportation. Mixed population. Poor housing. Smoke and dirt from R.R.
areaDesc.14: A very poor section of undesirable tenants. Negro is concentrated along RR tracks. There are a good number of shack type houses in the section.

areaDesc.3: Near center of city. Good tranportation and school.
areaDesc.4: Hilly ground. Mixture of population. Section is very spotty. Small lots.

5.a: Mixture of all types Polish, Slave

areaDesc.14: Section has been cleaned up considerably in recent years through effors of a Catholic Priest. Hoodlums have been forded to leave the neighborhood, and the general character of the area has improved slightly. At present the housing is a poor third grade with some rather good units scattered throughout.

areaDesc.3: West side of RR, and, consequently not subject to smoke of RR. Paved streets & alleys. Good schools & transportation. Pride of ownership in area.
areaDesc.4: Hilly topography. Small lots. Section is somewhat spotty with fair and good houses interspersed throughout.
areaDesc.14: Northeastern end of section is not convenient to high school or down town commercial area, but the general character of the section is uniform throughout. Considered very desirable by local RR men because of location. Houses are bery modest and in good demand, although many old houses are scattered throughout, some in poor condition.

areaDesc.3: Desirable section of substantial houses on good size lots. Restricted to $5000 houses minimum.
areaDesc.4: Distance to schools. Distance to car line.
areaDesc.14: Lower end of section has less expensive units. Between 11th and 13th Streets from 22nd to 27th are houses in the higher price bracket which are very good second grade. Balance of the section is equally desirable although housing is less expensive.

areaDesc.3: Good transportation and schools - Desirable section of good character.
areaDesc.4: None except distance to center of city.
areaDesc.14: A fairly new section of good houses which held up rather well in prices. Section is strictly residential. Additional development is restricted to $5000 housing.

areaDesc.2: Hilly, not conducive to good development
areaDesc.3: Cheap rents. Fairly convenient to Juniata railroad shops and yards.
areaDesc.4: No paving, No sidewalks. Poor transportation, poor topography. Many streets impassable in bad weather. Houses need painting very badly.

6.d: Poor a few in fair condition

areaDesc.14: Heavy foreclosures throughout this neighborhood. Section is very spotty and the area does not have a very promising future. The general character of the neighborhood is poor. Topography is not conducive to good development.

areaDesc.3: A desirable area of modest homes in a clean and quiet neighborhhod. Section enjoys good character. Convenient to two new factories along RR tracks.
areaDesc.4: Poor transportation and schools at lower end.

5.a: Business& Professional men Few RR Trainmen

areaDesc.14: Upper end of the section is better. Executives of two new factories (Glass plant & silk mill) are locating in this section. Houses are substantially built and well spaced.
